meanings.definition: To make unable to act or function properly
meanings.sent1: The injury will incapacitate him from playing in the match.
meanings.sent2: The virus can incapacitate a person's ability to work.
meanings.sent3: Trying to dance with a sprained ankle would surely incapacitate any fancy footwork.
meanings.sent4: The lack of sleep can incapacitate your concentration like a fog over a city.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's nemesis used a special ray to incapacitate his powers during the battle.

meanings.sent1: The hacker attempted to incapacitate the security system of the bank.
meanings.sent2: The poison was designed to incapacitate the enemy soldiers quickly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to incapacitate the volunteer's ability to speak.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds threatened to incapacitate the fragile tent.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was to incapacitate the hero's strength with a mysterious potion.

meanings.sent1: The new law could incapacitate the opposition's ability to protest.
meanings.sent2: The spy's mission was to incapacitate the enemy's communication channels.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning remote control seemed to incapacitate the TV's power button.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by his closest friend incapacitated his trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse was said to incapacitate anyone who dared to enter the forbidden temple.
